title: Installation issue: Compilers spack installs aren't set up correctly
body:
EDIT: See below, my problem was not filling out the `module` field for my `compilers.yaml`

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ # get clang-7:
$ spack install llvm
$ # load llvm + get spack to see it as a compiler
$ # try to install cmake:
$ spack install cmake %clang@7.0.0
==> Executing phase: 'bootstrap'
==> './bootstrap' '--prefix=${SPACK_DIR}/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/clang-7.0.0/cmake-3.13.2-qteyftgo4ny65ctu3agmauetc5bvyhyk' '--parallel=72' '--no-system-libs' '--no-qt-gui' '--' '-DCMAKE_USE_OPENSSL=ON'
---------------------------------------------
CMake 3.13.2, Copyright 2000-2018 Kitware, Inc. and Contributors
C compiler on this system is: ${SPACK_DIR}/lib/spack/env/clang/clang
---------------------------------------------
Error when bootstrapping CMake:
Cannot find a C++ compiler that supports both C++11 and the specified C++ flags.
Please specify one using environment variable CXX.
The C++ flags are "".
They can be changed using the environment variable CXXFLAGS.
See cmake_bootstrap.log for compilers attempted.
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux borax5 3.10.0-862.14.4.1chaos.ch6.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 26 12:27:08 PDT 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.5 (Maipo)
``` 

compilers.yaml:
```
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: ${SPACK_DIR}/spack_root/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/llvm-7.0.0-n3gfswbny2e63kq7asd6styoqlcmv7mq/bin/clang
      cxx: ${SPACK_DIR}/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/llvm-7.0.0-n3gfswbny2e63kq7asd6styoqlcmv7mq/bin/clang++
      f77: null
      fc: null
    spec: clang@7.0.0
    target: x86_64
```

### Additional information

 * `${SPACK_STAGE_DIR}/cmake-3.13.2/spack-build.env` doesn't list either LD_LIBRARY_PATH or LIBRARY_PATH, so I don't see how cmake could possibly know where libc++ is.

 * gcc7.3.0 builds cmake correctly; clang-6 doesn't work either

Let me know if there's anything else you want me to try.

I'm guessing messing with `environment` or `extra_rpaths` in the compilers.yaml will fix this, but then `spack compiler find` should fill them in.
